page.title: 11Fair View Farm,Stockbridge
page.content: Fair View Farm has been owned by the{Foord family}since 1926.It is now run by Mr J.Foord,his son and another employee.The farm is{1 kilometre north {east of stockbridge}on the A30 road. The farm is 300 acres,200 acres used for spring barley and 100 acres of grass.Hay is grown on part of this. The{spring barley}is sown in February and harvested in August.A yield of three tons is expected from each acre.The barley is dried by cold air,and most of it is sold for seed. There is a herd of 90{Aberdeen {Angus cattle}which have been crossed with French{Limousin}cattle to produce leaner meat.These are sold when they are 2 years old. The{hay}is artificially dried and some of it is sold for Â£2 a bale.The barley{straw}is sold for 50p a bale.
